Package LoggerFrame

Enum LoggerPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<LoggerPolicy>
      • LoggerFrame.LoggerPolicy

  • public enum LoggerPolicy
extends java.lang.Enum<LoggerPolicy>
    Defines which loggers should run. The current Logger Framework offers three different logger policies: Console, File and Discord. Each one of these can be better understood in this enum's description of each field.

    An Important Note on Logger Policies!

    It is important to remember that logger policies are inclusive. This means that if you select the File policy, the Logger Framework will log to the file and to the console. If you choose the Discord policy, the framework will log to the discord server log channel, the file and to the console. Choosing the console policy will only log to the console. Log policies are inclusive of the lower logger priorities in the heirarchy. 

              HEIRARCHY:
         -   Discord (Level 2).
         -   File (Level 1).
         -   Console (Level 0).
    Since:
    v1.5
    Version:
    v1.5
    Author:
    ArcStone Development LLC

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant Description
      CONSOLE
      Defines a policy which sends log messages to the ConsoleLogger only.
      DISCORD
      Defines a policy which sends log messages to the ConsoleLogger, FileLogger, and to the DiscordLogger.
      FILE
      Defines a policy which sends log messages to the ConsoleLogger and to the FileLogger.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • CONSOLE

        public static final LoggerPolicy CONSOLE
        Defines a policy which sends log messages to the ConsoleLogger only. The console logging policy is the lowest in the heirarchy. As such, choosing this policy will only log to the console. This is not the recommended logging policy -- it should only be used for debugging and development purposes, as the console is not always available on runtime.

      • FILE

        public static final LoggerPolicy FILE
        Defines a policy which sends log messages to the ConsoleLogger and to the FileLogger. The file logging policy is the middle policy. Choosing this policy is recommended. While it does encompass the Console Logger, more valuable is the ability to store data in the logger.txt file for viewing after runtime. It is important to note that the FileLogger writes over the logger.txt each time the program runs. If you do not want to loose the logging archive file, please rename it or move it before restarting the program.

      • DISCORD

        public static final LoggerPolicy DISCORD
        Defines a policy which sends log messages to the ConsoleLogger, FileLogger, and to the DiscordLogger. The Discord logging policy should only be used for logging events or command responses that specifically relate to a particular Discord guild. Bear in mind, if you choose this policy, it is important to provide the LoggerCore with a valid Discord Server ID.

        The level of the enum constant in the hierarchical (0 - 2).

      • getLoggers

        public int[] getLoggers​()
        This is the method responsible for making all logging policies inclusive. This method will get a given enum's hierarchical value and return an array of integers from zero to the hierarchical value.
        Returns:
        int[] - The array of policy values that should be run with the given enum constant.
